info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 12:27AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, northeastern Mobile, Baldwin, southeastern Washington, southeastern Clarke, western Escambia, Santa Rosa and Escambia Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1127 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Jackson to Atmore to 10 miles north of Point Baker. Movement was southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Gonzalez, Bay Minette, Atmore, Pace, Milton, Goulding, Robertsdale, Creola, Century, Flomaton, Loxley, Stockton, McCullough, Stapleton and Axis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.
